body.p: A Tennessee-born, Kentucky carpenter and miller. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Attended county schools in Gibson County, Tennessee. Worked as a carpenter in Hickman, Kentucky and Cannelton, Indiana. Married to Rose Ann Davidson Shelley. Father of Mary B. Shelley, Annie T. Shelley, Clara Shelley, Carrie M. Shelley, Hattie Emma Shelley, Estelle Shelley, Geneva P. Shelley, and Hiram L. Shelley. Moved to Hawesville, Kentucky in 1852. He worked in the manufacturing of shingles and the distillery business starting from 1860-66, when he opened a steam flouring-mill. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville.
